result.execSummary:
The defendant Glen D Voden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program and is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.  2 days credit granted if imposed.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied and balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
To be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Comply with Day Report Center for 6 months consecutive to the condition time.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  DNA Sample to be provided if not yet previously done.  Attendance at Victim Impact Panel completed on 01-20-2016.
 If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber, NON WORKING HOURS. with standard release conditions, including release for Community Service and Treatment.  Sentence to begin FORTHWITH.
To be performed as a condition of probation.

Hearing at 11-23-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Glen D Voden in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  City of New Berlin police officer Thomas Johannik sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Behm.  Cross examination by Attorney Menden.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Attorney Menden objects.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Menden requests the court approve that Mr Voden report to WCS in Milwaukee.  No objection from the State.  Court indicates the defendant can be supervised through an office in Milwaukee as long as it is approved by WCS.  Hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing at 10-29-2015 08:15 am

COURT ORDERED A $_500.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $_2500.00 SIGNATURE BOND.Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.   Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody. Defendant allowed non collect phone calls.
